item.title: Rohit Sharma Told He's Not In BCCI Selectors' Test Plans, Chat With Virat Kohli Soon: Report - News18
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Excluded from BCCI Test Plans, Future Uncertain

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: News18

Rohit Sharma has reportedly been informed by BCCI selectors that he is no longer part of their plans for future Test matches. This decision follows his absence from the Indian squad for the final Test against Australia.

  • Rohit has not played since the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne.
  • The selectors met to discuss the team’s future, and Rohit’s exclusion seems unanimous.
  • Virat Kohli’s future will also be discussed after the ongoing match in Sydney.
  • Jasprit Bumrah is anticipated to lead the team in Rohit's absence if India qualifies for the 2025 World Test Championship Final.
“Obviously, our captain has shown his leadership as well. He’s opted to rest in this game. So that shows that there’s a lot of unity in our team.” - Jasprit Bumrah

The Boxing Day Test may have been Rohit Sharma's last appearance in whites for India as discussions on team strategy shift with an eye towards future tournaments.

item.title: Forgotten India Star Scripts History, Registers World Record Ahead Of IPL 2025 - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Karun Nair Sets World Record Ahead of IPL 2025

Publication Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: NDTV Sports

Karun Nair made history by setting the record for the most List A runs without being dismissed, achieving a remarkable total of 542 runs during the Vijay Hazare Trophy.

  • Nair surpassed the previous record of 527 runs held by James Franklin since 2010.
  • His latest performance included a score of 112 runs, contributing significantly to Vidarbha's win against Uttar Pradesh.
  • Yash Rathod also showcased an impressive performance with an unbeaten 138 runs, leading to Vidarbha's successful chase of 308 runs.
  • Vidarbha secured their position at the top of Group D with 20 points from five matches.
“Karun's fourth hundred in the tournament highlights his exceptional form.”

This achievement places Karun Nair in the spotlight ahead of the IPL 2025, marking a noteworthy comeback in his cricket career.

item.title: India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 1: AUS 9/1 at Stumps vs IND in Sydney - The Indian Express
item.description:
India vs Australia 5th Test Day 1 Highlights

Date: January 5, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

On Day 1 of the 5th Test in Sydney, India set a target of 185 runs, with Australia ending the day at 9/1, trailing by 176 runs. Jasprit Bumrah starred for India, taking the lone Australian wicket at stumps.

  • India won the toss and opted to bat first, scoring 185 runs.
  • Rishabh Pant was the top scorer for India with 40 runs.
  • Scott Boland was the standout bowler for Australia, claiming four wickets.
  • Jasprit Bumrah dismissed Usman Khawaja on the last ball of the day.
“India has to win the Test match to retain the Border Gavaskar trophy.”

Day 1 concluded with Australia at 9/1, needing 176 more runs to surpass India’s score.

item.title: Sams and Bancroft taken to hospital after horrific on-field collision - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Sams and Bancroft taken to hospital after horrific on-field collision

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The article reports on a serious incident during a cricket match where players Sams and Bancroft collided on the field, resulting in both being hospitalized.

  • Both players suffered concussions and were sent to the hospital for assessment.
  • There are concerns about possible fractures.
  • The collision occurred during the 16th over of the innings when both players were running for the ball.
  • The Thunder team stopped play for about 20 minutes to address the situation.
  • Sams was carried off in a stretcher, while Bancroft walked off with assistance, showing a significant injury.
  • Thunder captain David Warner and coaches consulted with match officials about the incident.
  • Players expressed their hopes for the recovery of their teammates.
“They both are in the hospital, so I'm praying that they can come out soon and be back on the park.” - Sherfane Rutherford

The incident highlights the risks involved in sports and the immediate response required for player safety.

item.title: 'Jassi bhai se panga nahi': Late Day 1 madness involving Jasprit Bumrah, Sam Konstas sparks meme fest - The Times of India
item.description:
Jassi bhai se panga nahi: Late Day 1 madness involving Jasprit Bumrah, Sam Konstas sparks meme fest

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: Times of India

The article discusses a viral moment involving cricketer Jasprit Bumrah and social media influencer Sam Konstas that has sparked a huge meme fest online.

  • Jasprit Bumrah's unique engagement with fans caught attention.
  • Sam Konstas humorously reacted to Bumrah's actions.
  • Meme creators quickly made content that resonated with the audience.
“Jassi bhai se panga nahi,” became the catchphrase following the incident.

The combination of sports and humor has created a wave of memes that showcases the vibrant online interaction between celebrities and fans.

item.title: Rohit Sharma Told He's Not In BCCI's Test Plans, Meeting With Virat Kohli Soon: Report - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Excluded from BCCI Test Plans, Meeting with Virat Kohli Scheduled

Publication Date: December 8, 2024 | Source: NDTV Sports

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has communicated to Rohit Sharma that he will not be part of future Test cricket plans following the current series against Australia. Following this, a meeting is planned between BCCI selectors and Virat Kohli to discuss his future in the format.

  • Rohit Sharma's exclusion follows poor performance, averaging just 6.2 in three Tests against Australia.
  • Jasprit Bumrah is expected to lead the team in the World Test Championship if India qualifies.
  • Rishabh Pant describes Rohit's exclusion as an 'emotional decision.'
  • Ravindra Jadeja is still considered vital for the team's future.
“It was an emotional decision because he's been the captain for a long time. We see him as the leader of the team.” - Rishabh Pant

This decision signifies a potential shift in the Indian cricket team's strategy as they prepare for future challenges, emphasizing a transitional phase with new leadership.

item.title: ‘Downplayed Magnus’ attacks on Viswanathan Anand’: FIDE CEO destroys Carlsen after controversial Rapid and Blitz C’ship - Hindustan Times
item.description:
FIDE CEO Emil Sutovsky Criticizes Magnus Carlsen After Controversial Championship

Date: Jan 03, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Emil Sutovsky, the CEO of FIDE, has publicly countered Magnus Carlsen's criticisms following the controversial World Rapid and Blitz Championship.

  • Sutovsky refuted Carlsen's claim that FIDE threatened players during the World Rapid Championship.
  • Carlsen shared the World Blitz title with Ian Nepomniachtchi amidst controversy.
  • Sutovsky criticized media and streamers for downplaying Carlsen's attacks on Viswanathan Anand.
  • A recent agreement was made between FIDE and the Freestyle Chess Players Club recognizing the Grand Slam Tour.
“It is funny how some platforms/streamers downplay the 'we can just keep making draws' case.” - Emil Sutovsky

This clash between leading chess figures highlights ongoing tensions within the chess community regarding competition and representation.

item.title: Selectors inform Rohit Sharma he is no longer needed in Tests, to meet Virat Kohli to plan next stage of Indian cricket - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Selectors inform Rohit Sharma he is no longer needed in Tests, to meet Virat Kohli to plan next stage of Indian cricket

Date: Jan 03, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In all likelihood, Rohit Sharma has played his last Test for India. The selectors have also set to discuss with Virat Kohli regarding his future in Indian cricket.

  • Rohit Sharma opted to rest for the final Test against Australia.
  • He has struggled for runs, with scores of 3, 6, 10, 3, and 9 in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • The selectors have communicated to Rohit that he is not part of plans beyond the Australia tour.
  • Virat Kohli has also been having a disappointing series, with similar dismissals observed throughout.
  • The selectors will discuss Kohli's future after the series ends.
  • Ravindra Jadeja is expected to remain as his presence is valued in the team's transition.
“Obviously, our captain (Rohit) has shown his leadership as well. He’s opted to rest in this game. So that shows that there’s a lot of unity in our team.” - Jasprit Bumrah

This marks a significant transition in Indian cricket as senior players are reassessed after the ongoing series against Australia.

item.title: Bumrah vs Konstas continues to enliven Border-Gavaskar Trophy - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Exciting Duels Continue in Border-Gavaskar Trophy with Bumrah and Konstas

Publication Date: Not specified Source: ESPN Cricinfo

The opening day of the final Test at the SCG featured a heated exchange between Sam Konstas and Jasprit Bumrah, setting the stage for a thrilling continuation of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy rivalry.

  • Konstas walked down the crease to Bumrah's first delivery, quickly scoring runs and engaging in verbal exchanges.
  • Bumrah secured an important dismissal with the last ball of the day, heightening tension on the field.
  • Rishabh Pant noted the players' interactions were designed to waste time and disrupt the momentum.
  • Konstas' performance has significantly impacted the series, showcasing his talent and confidence.
“He's playing with a lot of flair... You can see that in the last few moments there.” - Scott Boland

The match intensifies as India aims to retain the Border-Gavaskar Trophy with Bumrah expected to play a pivotal role in the contest.

item.title: [Watch] Saim Ayub Taken Off The Field On Stretcher After Nasty Injury In 2nd Test vs South Africa - OneCricket
item.description:
Saim Ayub Injured During 2nd Test vs South Africa

Publication Date: Recent
Source: One Cricket News

The 2nd Test between Pakistan and South Africa saw a significant blow for Pakistan as Saim Ayub was taken off the field on a stretcher due to a nasty injury.

  • The injury occurred while Ayub attempted to stop a boundary, slipping and twisting his ankle.
  • He was attended by physios and left the field after heavy taping of his foot.
  • Pakistan is concerned about his injury as the Champions Trophy 2025 is approaching.
  • Babar Azam was seen consoling Ayub until medical help arrived.
  • South Africa started the match positively, being 53/0 at the time.
“It is a big blow for Pakistan as Ayub, who hasn't done much in the ongoing series, was in form in white-ball series.”

Pakistan hopes for positive news regarding Ayub’s condition as he has been taken to the hospital for scans.

item.title: Rishabh Pant ends silence on Rohit Sharma's 'conversation' behind 'opting out' of Sydney Test: 'It was an emotional...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rishabh Pant Discusses Rohit Sharma's Emotional Decision to Opt Out of Sydney Test

Date: Jan 03, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Rishabh Pant opened up regarding Rohit Sharma's absence from the fifth Test in Sydney, highlighting that it was an emotional decision influenced by recent performances and team dynamics.

  • Rohit opted out of the Sydney Test following poor performances and internal team conflicts.
  • Jasprit Bumrah took over the captaincy role for the match.
  • Pant described Rohit as the team's leader and acknowledged the emotional weight of the decision.
  • Rohit averaged just 6.2 runs over the series, exacerbating the situation leading to tensions with coach Gautam Gambhir.
  • India struggled on Day 1 of the Test, ending at 185 all out.
“It was an emotional decision because he has been captain for a long time. We see him as a leader of the team.” - Rishabh Pant

The situation within the team remains delicate as India intends to rebound in the remaining matches of the series.

item.title: Big call in Sydney: Selectors told Rohit Sharma they were looking beyond him after SCG Test - The Indian Express
item.description:
Rohit Sharma's Future in Test Cricket Uncertain After Selection Decision

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Indian Express

Rohit Sharma's absence from the playing XI in Sydney signals a potential shift in the Indian cricket team's direction, as selectors look beyond him for future red-ball cricket.

  • Rohit Sharma was not included in the team for the Sydney Test, suggesting a significant change in the selectors' strategy post-Australia tour.
  • Head coach Gautam Gambhir and the selectors communicated their plan, indicating a transition in leadership with upcoming series.
  • Rohit's recent performance raised concerns, leading to a decision to rest him amidst struggles with the bat.
  • Stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah addressed the team’s unity during the toss, acknowledging Rohit’s choice to rest.
  • Former players anticipate this may mark Rohit's last Test as selectorial decisions lean towards younger talent for future events including the Champions Trophy.
“I think it probably means that (if) India don’t qualify for the WTC final, the Melbourne Test will be Rohit Sharma’s last game.” - Sunil Gavaskar

The decision regarding Rohit Sharma's role in the team reflects a broader strategy of transitioning to new players, signaling an ending of an era in Indian Test cricket.

item.title: Virat Kohli's contentious first-ball survival explained - ICC Cricket
item.description:
Virat Kohli's Contentious First-Ball Survival Explained

Publication Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: ICC Cricket

This article discusses the controversial third-umpire decision regarding a catch involving Virat Kohli during the fifth Border-Gavaskar Test at the SCG, where he survived an initial dismissal call.

  • Virat Kohli faced a catch call on the first ball he faced, edging a delivery from Scott Boland towards Steve Smith.
  • Third umpire Joel Wilson ruled that the ball touched the ground before being caught, leading to Kohli's not out decision.
  • Cricket experts and former players had mixed opinions regarding the legitimacy of the catch.
  • Kohli was ultimately dismissed later in the innings by Boland.
“100% (the catch was fair). No denying it whatsoever.” — Steve Smith

In conclusion, the decision sparked significant debate in the cricket community about the nuances of fair catch rulings and the challenges of third umpire reviews.

item.title: Watch: Rishabh Pant Left Bruised By Australia Pacers, Responds WIth A Mammoth Six - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rishabh Pant Resilient Against Australia, Smashes a Mammoth Six

Publication Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: NDTV

In a display of determination during the fifth Test against Australia, Rishabh Pant scored 40 runs while enduring tough conditions, facing fierce pace bowling.

  • Pant was hit by Mitchell Starc’s delivery but continued his innings.
  • He hit a remarkable six off debutant Beau Webster, showcasing his skills.
  • Pant reflected on adapting his batting style due to the challenging pitch conditions.
“In this innings, I wasn't in frame of mind where I felt I could take charge of the game looking at nature of the wicket.” - Rishabh Pant

Pant's ability to adapt signifies his growth as a cricketer, as he balances aggression with caution for better performance in challenging situations.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah's Aggressive Celebration After Taking Usman Khawaja's Wicket Goes Viral: Watch - News18
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah's Aggressive Celebration After Taking Usman Khawaja's Wicket Goes Viral: Watch

Date: January 03, 2025 | Source: News18

Indian captain Jasprit Bumrah dismissed Australian opener Usman Khawaja on the last ball of Day 1 of the fifth Test at Sydney. His aggressive celebration has gone viral.

  • Bumrah took Khawaja's wicket with a catch by KL Rahul.
  • His aggressive celebration was directed towards Sam Konstas.
  • This dismissal was Bumrah's 31st in the series, tying him with Bishan Singh Bedi for the most wickets in a Test series between India and Australia in Australia.
  • Bumrah is close to breaking the record for the most wickets in a Test series held by Harbhajan Singh.
Bumrah’s reaction came after he and Konstas got engaged in a verbal battle during the third over.

Bumrah's impressive performance continues to gain attention as he approaches record-setting milestones in this Test series.

item.title: India vs Australia 5th Test Day 1 Highlights: Bumrah gets Khawaja in dramatic final over, AUS 9/1 at Stumps - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia 5th Test Day 1 Highlights

Date & Source: January 3, 2025, Hindustan Times

The first day of the fifth Test between India and Australia ended with India bowled out for 185. Rishabh Pant fought hard with a knock of 40, while Jasprit Bumrah made a quickfire 22. Australian bowlers dominated, with Scott Boland taking crucial wickets.

  • India were bowled out for 185.
  • Rishabh Pant fell for 40, triggering a collapse.
  • Jasprit Bumrah played a brief cameo, ending with 22 runs.
  • Australia ended Day 1 at 9/1 at stumps.
  • Bumrah took the last wicket of the day, dismissing Usman Khawaja.
“Rishabh Pant’s resistance ended early into the third session.”

In conclusion, India's batting struggles continue as they face Australia in the fifth Test under significant pressure, particularly with their hopes for the World Test Championship hanging in the balance.

item.title: India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test, Day 1: Usman Khawaja Out On Last Ball Of Day 1 As Jasprit Bumrah Clashes With Sam Konstas - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test, Day 1: Usman Khawaja Out On Last Ball Of Day 1 As Jasprit Bumrah Clashes With Sam Konstas

Date: January 3, 2025   Source: NDTV

On Day 1 of the 5th Test, India was bowled out for 185, while Australia ended the day at 9 for 1 after Khawaja fell to Bumrah on the last ball. Rishabh Pant top-scored for India with 40 runs in a challenging outing.

  • India scored 185 runs, recovering from a poor start at 57 for 3.
  • Rishabh Pant was the top scorer with 40 runs from 98 balls.
  • Scott Boland took 4 wickets for 31 runs for Australia.
  • Jasprit Bumrah struck with the final ball of the day, removing Usman Khawaja.
  • Captain Rohit Sharma rested himself, allowing Bumrah to lead during the toss.
“Bumrah gets the breakthrough with the last ball of Day 1.”

This gripping match sets the stage for an exciting continuation as both teams aim to capitalize on their strategies moving forward.

item.title: India vs Australia 5th Test Day 1 LIVE Score: Pant, Jadeja fall in quick succession as Boland, Starc strike; IND 9 down - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia 5th Test Day 1 LIVE Score

Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

On Day 1 of the 5th Test, Rishabh Pant was pivotal for India before falling to Scott Boland after scoring 40 runs. Boland and Mitchell Starc troubled the Indian batting lineup, causing a series of dismissals.

  • Rishabh Pant scored 40 runs before being dismissed by Boland.
  • Indian team was 107/4 at tea, struggling against Australian bowlers.
  • Virat Kohli and KL Rahul fell early, pressuring the middle order.
  • Scott Boland took crucial wickets including Jadeja and Nitish Kumar Reddy.
“Pant's innings showed resilience but ended too soon, falling on a poor shot.”

The match intensity is escalating with Australia showing strong dominance, while India needs crucial partnerships to turn the tide.

item.description:
India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test, Day 1: Usman Khawaja Out On Last Ball Of Day 1 As Jasprit Bumrah Clashes With Sam Konstas

Date: January 3, 2025   Source: NDTV

On Day 1 of the 5th Test, India was bowled out for 185, while Australia ended the day at 9 for 1 after Khawaja fell to Bumrah on the last ball. Rishabh Pant top-scored for India with 40 runs in a challenging outing.

  • India scored 185 runs, recovering from a poor start at 57 for 3.
  • Rishabh Pant was the top scorer with 40 runs from 98 balls.

  • Jasprit Bumrah struck with the final ball of the day, removing Usman Khawaja.

“Bumrah gets the breakthrough with the last ball of Day 1.”

This gripping match sets the stage for an exciting continuation as both teams aim to capitalize on their strategies moving forward.

item.title: Ravi Shastri reveals why he couldn't ask Jasprit Bumrah about Rohit Sharma at the toss of Sydney Test - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ravi Shastri Explains His Delay in Asking Bumrah About Rohit Sharma at Sydney Test Toss

Date: Jan 03, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former Indian cricket coach Ravi Shastri shared insights on why he didn't immediately inquire about Rohit Sharma's absence at the toss for the Sydney Test. This match was crucial as India was down 1-2 and needed a win to retain the trophy.

  • Jasprit Bumrah won the toss and chose to bat, revealing Rohit Sharma had opted out of the match.
  • Shastri didn't ask about Rohit's absence right at the toss, focusing instead on team composition.
  • Bumrah stated, "Our captain has shown his leadership; he's opted to rest in this game," affirming team unity.
  • Criticism arose from former batter Sanjay Manjrekar regarding Shastri's approach at the toss.
  • Shastri suggested that Rohit might consider retiring from Test cricket if his form does not improve.
"It's not that India don't have youngsters. There are very, very good players in the wings and it's time to build." - Ravi Shastri

In conclusion, the decision by Rohit Sharma to sit out was seen as a sign of strong leadership, but it also sparked discussions about his future in the format.

item.title: Drama at SCG! Nervous Rohit Sharma jumps out of his seat for Virat Kohli’s golden duck call - The Times of India
item.description:
Drama at SCG! Nervous Rohit Sharma jumps out of his seat for Virat Kohli’s golden duck call

Publication Date: None available Source: Times of India

The SCG Test brought a moment of high tension when Virat Kohli survived a golden duck on the very first delivery he faced. A contentious umpiring decision favored the Indian star batter, sparking drama in the 8th over.

  • Scott Boland dismissed Yashasvi Jaiswal earlier in the over.
  • A delivery from Boland found Kohli's outside edge but was ruled not out after replays showed it brushed the ground.
  • TV umpire Joel Wilson ruled Kohli not out, leading to visible tension for Rohit Sharma, who was watching from the dressing room.
  • Once the decision was confirmed, Rohit Sharma appeared relieved.
“Was the decision to rule Virat Kohli not out the right call?”

The incident highlighted the pressures of the game, especially for those on the sidelines, and marked a moment of relief for the Indian dressing room.
